concise_definition: n. 怨恨, 怀恨; v. 怀恨, 不情愿地给予

definitions.explanation_en: A feeling of persistent resentment or ill will toward someone, often because of a real or perceived wrong, and usually held over a long period of time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种对某人长期持有的强烈怨恨或敌意，通常源于实际或想象中的伤害或不公。
definitions.example_en: She still holds a grudge against her former boss for not promoting her.
definitions.example_cn: 她至今仍对前上司不提拔她心怀怨恨。

definitions.explanation_en: To feel or harbor resentment toward someone, especially when forced to do something they perceive as unfair or undesirable.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对某人怀有怨恨，尤其在被迫做某事时，认为此事不公平或令人不快。
definitions.example_en: He grudged his brother the success he had worked so hard to achieve.
definitions.example_cn: 他嫉妒弟弟凭借努力获得的成功。

definitions.explanation_en: Used in the form 'grudging' to describe something done reluctantly, with minimal willingness or without generosity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以 'grudging' 形式使用，形容某事是勉强、不情愿地做的，缺乏慷慨或热情。
definitions.example_en: She gave a grudging apology after being pressured by her colleagues.
definitions.example_cn: 在同事的压力下，她勉强道了歉。

comparison.analysis: “Resentment” (怨恨) 是一个更广泛、更抽象的名词，泛指因不公或伤害而产生的负面情绪，不一定伴随行动或长期性。而 “grudge” 更强调一种持久、固执、带有报复倾向的怨恨，常与具体的人和事件相关联。
“Jealousy” (嫉妒) 源于对他人拥有自己渴望之物的不满，核心是“想要”；而 “grudge” 的核心是“不满被亏待”，即使自己并不想要对方的东西，仍因对方获得而心生怨恨。两者可能并存，但动机不同。
“Bitterness” (苦涩/怨毒) 是一种更广泛的情绪状态，可能源于失败、失望或创伤，不一定针对特定对象。而 “grudge” 总是针对某个具体的人或群体，具有明确的指向性，且常伴随拒绝原谅的态度。
